abstract: Google agrees to buy Postini, a company that offers message security services, for $625 million in cash. Eric Schmidt doesn’t mince words that the company is going full speed into the hosted corporate applications market.
snippet: Google agrees to buy Postini, a company that offers message security services, for $625 million in cash. Eric Schmidt doesn’t mince words that the company is going full speed into the hosted corporate applications market.
lead_paragraph: Google agreed to buy Postini, which offers a service to help companies protect and control their e-mail , for $625 million in cash.

abstract: Google said on Monday it has agreed to buy Postini, a maker of Web-based security software, for $625 million, expanding its package of online applications to compete with Microsoft‘s Office suite of programs. Postini provides security and encryption services, protecting instant messaging, e-mail and other communications, to more than 35,000 businesses and 10 million users worldwide.
lead_paragraph: Google said on Monday it has agreed to buy Postini, a maker of Web-based security software, for $625 million, expanding its package of online applications to compete with Microsoft‘s Office suite of programs. Postini provides security and encryption services, protecting instant messaging, e-mail and other communications, to more than 35,000 businesses and 10 million users worldwide.

headline.main: Google to Acquire Postini for $625 Million
